title: How to Turn Off Auto Delete Old Conversations + Recover

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. This is the cog icon. When this feature is set to anything other than Forever , it will permanently delete older messages. If needed, you can try to recover deleted messages .

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you're using an older version of iOS, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . This is next to the speech bubble icon.

steps.title: Tap Keep Messages.
steps.content: Tap Keep Messages . You can find this towards the bottom of the page; you may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Tap Forever.
steps.content: Tap Forever . Messages will no longer be deleted automatically from your device.

steps.title: Check your Recently Deleted.
steps.content: Check your Recently Deleted. If you want to recover messages deleted by this feature, you can try checking the Recently Deleted section. [1] X Research source This feature is only available on iOS 16 and later. Open Messages . Tap Edit . Tap Show Recently Deleted . Tap the message. Tap Recover .

steps.title: Revert to an older backup.
steps.content: Revert to an older backup. If you want to recover deleted messages not found in your Recently Deleted, you can try restoring from a backup . If you have Messages enabled in iCloud, the changes may have already synced, and it's unlikely you'll be able to recover the messages.

steps.title: Contact Apple.
steps.content: Contact Apple. If the above methods don't work, you can try contacting Apple's support team for help in restoring your messages. You can contact Apple on their website at https://getsupport.apple.com/ .
